page.title: 18Rectories,Ayot st.Lawrence
page.content: {THE OLD RECTORY }which dates back to 1291, at least, is now divided into three houses. A window from the old church has been installed in the house. One of the most famous people to live in the village was{Bernard Shaw,}a dramatist,who wanted to change English spelling so that it would be easier. He was also a vegetarian.He bought the {New Rectory}in 1906 renaming it { {Shaw's Corner.}Probably his most well known play is{Pygmalion}better known as{My Fair Lady.}He printed postcards to send to people who bothered him for money or advice.They were very witty! His home was Shaw's Corner until he died in 1950 aged 94.He gave the house to the National Trust just after his wife died,in 1943.
